Interface ViewInterface

    Frame

    public interface ViewInterface
    View interface methods. MIT Open Source License
    Version:
    1.1
    Author:
    Cathy Jin (cj8g10) Southampton University, United Kingdom

    • Method Detail

      • setInstructionList

        void setInstructionList(java.util.ArrayList<Instruction> instructions)
        Set the instructions to be displayed in the instruction dropdown box and tooltip descriptions. This method should be called after the view is created.
        Parameters:
        instructions - Instruction set with descriptions.

      • setProgramCode

        void setProgramCode(java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>> program)
        Set the program code to be displayed in the input editor.
        Parameters:
        program - An ArrayList of instruction lines. Each instruction is an ArrayList composed of three Strings.

      • setFilename

        void setFilename(java.lang.String filename)
        Set the filename of the current program.
        Parameters:
        filename - Filename of current program.

      • setAccStack

        void setAccStack(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> values)
        Set the values to be displayed in the accumulator register visualisation. Uses an ArrayList to show the history of values from oldest to newest.
        Parameters:
        values - The values to be displayed.

      • setXStack

        void setXStack(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> values)
        Set the values to be displayed in the X register visualisation. Uses an ArrayList to show the history of values from oldest to newest.
        Parameters:
        values - The values to be displayed.

      • setYStack

        void setYStack(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> values)
        Set the values to be displayed in the Y register visualisation. Uses an ArrayList to show the history of values from oldest to newest.
        Parameters:
        values - The values to be displayed.

      • setCarryFlag

        void setCarryFlag(boolean flagIsOn)
        Set the state to be displayed in the carry status flag visualisation.
        Parameters:
        flagIsOn - The state to be displayed.

      • setZeroFlag

        void setZeroFlag(boolean flagIsOn)
        Set the state to be displayed in the zero status flag visualisation.
        Parameters:
        flagIsOn - The state to be displayed.

      • setNegativeFlag

        void setNegativeFlag(boolean flagIsOn)
        Set the state to be displayed in the negative status flag visualisation.
        Parameters:
        flagIsOn - The state to be displayed.

      • setConsoleResult

        void setConsoleResult(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> text)
        Set the successful results to be displayed in the console output.
        Parameters:
        text - Result strings.

      • setConsoleError

        void setConsoleError(java.util.ArrayList<OutputError> errors)
        Set the errors to be displayed in the console output.
        Parameters:
        errors - Error strings

      • setMemoryAllocation

        void setMemoryAllocation(int[] memory)
        Set the values to be displayed in the memory visualisation.
        Parameters:
        values - The values to be displayed.

      • setButtonsEnabled

        void setButtonsEnabled(boolean isEnabled)
        Set the state of the run and step through buttons to be enabled or disabled. The buttons should be disabled until a successful compile has completed.
        Parameters:
        isEnabled - The state to be displayed.

      • clearVisualisations

        void clearVisualisations()
        Clear all visualisation views of their current values.

      • highlightStepThrough

        void highlightStepThrough(int currNo)
        Highlight the given line for the step through.
        Parameters:
        currNo - Line to highlight.

      • setIOEnabled

        void setIOEnabled(boolean isEnabled)
        Set the state of the IO port checkbox to be enabled or disabled. The state should be disabled unless the application is running on a Raspberry Pi.
        Parameters:
        isEnabled - The state to be displayed.
